(59) 147 Copy No.9th September, 1959CABINETUSE OF OFFICIAL TRANSPORT DURING THE GENERAL ELECTIONNote by the Prime MinisterOfficial CarsDuring the period of the General Election Ministers may continue to use, for official purposes, official cars provided from the Government Car Service orotherwise; but these cars should not be used for journeys connected with theElection. It is also undesirable that a Minister should use an official car, evenon official business, in his constituency, except on an occasion when he isunexpectedly called back from his constituency on urgent official business.Aircraft2. Service aircraft should not be used for journeys connected with theElection.3. The cost of civil aircraft should not be charged to public funds if usedfor journeys connected with the Election or other Party political business; but,exceptionally, a Minister recalled unexpectedly to his Department for urgentofficial business may claim repayment of the cost of an air journey if no other means of transport would meet the needs of the case.H. M.10 Downing Street, S.W. 1,9th September, 1959.CONFIDENTIAL
